description: Erection of hip to gable and rear dormer roof extensions and installation of 3 no. rooflights to front roofslope
decision_conditions: The proposed erection of hip to gable and rear dormer roof extensions and the installation of 3 no. rooflights to the front roofslope are considered to comply with Classes B and C of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Condition A.4 (2) of Class A in the  makes clear that a prior notification for a larger householder extension must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority  before beginning the development. Condition A.4 (10) is as follows:(10) The development must not begin before the occurrence of the following -(a)The receipt by the developer from the local planning authority of a written notice that their prior approval is not required;(b)The receipt by the developer from the local planning authority of a written notice giving their prior approval; or(c) The expiry of 42 days following the date on which the information referred to in sub-paragraph (2) was received by the local planning authority without the local planning authority notifying the developer as to whether prior approval is given or refused.None of the above occurrences have occurred . Should it be the case that works have commenced on site  ahead of any prior notification approval application being determined and issued , the Local Planning Authority decision  would become null and void.
All applications where new residential accommodation is proposed must provide a Water Consumption Statement. Please see page 95 of the Validation Local List for guidance.
